verses.verse: (Israel’s God—Judge of All the Earth) To the leader: with stringed instruments. A Psalm of Asaph. A Song. (Ps 48.3) In Judah God is known; his name is great in Israel.
(Ps 9.11; 27.5) His abode has been established in Salem, his dwelling place in Zion.
(Ps 46.9) There he broke the flashing arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah
Glorious are you, more majestic than the everlasting mountains. (Gk: Heb the mountains of prey)
(Ps 13.3; Isa 46.12) The courageous were stripped of their spoil; they sank into sleep; none of the troops was able to lift a hand.
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both rider and horse lay stunned.
(Ps 96.4; Nah 1.6) But you indeed are awesome! Who can stand before you when your anger is roused?
(2 Chr 20.29, 30; Ezek 38.20) From the heavens you uttered judgment; the earth feared and was still
(Ps 9.7-9; 72.4) when God rose up to establish judgment, to save all the oppressed of the earth. Selah
(Ex 9.16; Rom 9.17) Human wrath serves only to praise you, when you bind the last bit of your (Heb lacks your) wrath around you.
(Ps 50.14; 68.29) Make vows to the LORD your God and perform them; let all who are around him bring gifts to the one who is awesome,
(Ps 68.35) who cuts off the spirit of princes, who inspires fear in the kings of the earth.
